item.title: By: Tyler Provick
item.dc:creator: Tyler Provick
item.content:encoded:
I think you are spot on with your assessment. It’s funny, I think it’s a self-fulfilling prophecy. We have trouble proving the territory we claim is ours so we try to put ourselves so far ahead that even if we defend poorly we’re ok. This makes it harder to defend so we think “We need to get every further ahead”
It’s like bluffing in poker: we’re trying to make our opponent resign so we don’t have to prove that our moyo is not a house of cards.
I think this is the same mentality that makes kyu players want to punish their opponent as soon as they make a mistake and end up giving our opponent a free move to fix it.
